results.title: Sailor Moon. Ep 9: The Return of the doom tree [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Junichi Sato, Louise Hurtubise and Toei Animation
results.brief_description: Six episodes of the Japanese animated television series, “Sailor Moon”, entitled “The Return of the doom tree”. The setting is Cross Roads Junior High School and Serena, a young girl, possesses a magical brooch that invokes mystical forces, transforming her into the powerful Sailor Moon, a super-heroine whose mission is to protect humanity from evil demons from a parallel universe. Fellow Sailor Scouts, Jupiter, Mercury and Mars join her on her adventures. Episodes include: “Food fetish” Serena suspects that Darien, who she has a major crush on, may be the Moonlight Knight; “Mirror, mirror on the wall” When Darien stages Snow White and the seven dwarfs, the Sailor scouts compete for the major parts but wicked ulterior motives mar the proceedings; “Detention doldrums” Much to her dismay, Serena is detained after school. “Secret garden” When Serena uncovers the secret identities of Alan and Anne, she has to use the zenith of her powers to fight for her life. “Treed” Serena struggles to free herself from Alan and Anne’s doom tree. “Serena times two” Serena becomes jealous when a wicked baby falls from the sky in search of a powerful crystal. Based on the original comic “Sailor Moon” by Naoko Takeuchi. The series is underpinned by the decent moral codes of friendship, honesty, responsible behaviour, respect and selflessness.

results.title: Samson et Dalila
results.creator_credit: John Vernon, Elijah Moshinsky, BBC-TV and Covent Garden Video Productions
results.brief_description: Camille Saint-Saens’ opera Samson et Dalila in three acts with libretto by Ferdinand Lemaire recorded live for television at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden. Based on Chapter 16 of the Book of Judges, this is the story of Samson (John Vickers), hero of the Israelites, and his betrayal by Dalila (Shirley Verrett). Features the Royal Opera Chorus and Orchestra of the Royal Opera House conducted by Sir Colin Davis, choreography by David Bintley and scenery and costume designed by Sidney Nolan. Cast also includes Jonathan Summers, Gwynne Howell, John Tomlinson, Maldwyn Davies, Matthew Best, John Dobson. Sung in French.

results.title: Russia revisisted
results.brief_description: Moving beyond the popular images of ugly labour camps and frozen wastelands, Siberia in summer is stunningly beautiful as the inahabitants take advantage of the warm weeks. In St. Petersburg, we ride up the canals, incliding the famous Winter Canal. Joy turns to sadness as the mass war graves of half a million Russians who died during the seige of Leningrad in World War II, are visited. Filmed at the time of great change, this is a compelling insight into the lives of the soviets.

results.title: Same difference: all about twins
results.brief_description: Discusses Siamese twins, how different twins are formed and how, with some, the bond is so close that they can feel each other’s pain. A fascinating study that looks at different types of twins including dissimilar twins and those that prefer to live separate lives.

results.title: Sam Spiegel in a discussion with Ludovic Kennedy on the producer and the film
results.creator_credit: Hazel Wilkinson and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Sam Spiegel discusses his work as a film producer. Scenes from “Lawrence of Arabia”, “On the Waterfront”, “The African Queen” and “The Bridge on the River Kwai” are shown.

results.title: Salvation
results.creator_credit: Beth B, Michael H. Shanberg and B Movies
results.brief_description: Housewife Rhonda Stample (Exene Cervenka) - married to biker Jerome (Viggo Mortensen), has recently taken to donating her husband’s hard earned wages to Reverend Edward Randall (Stephen McHattie). Randall is a young, good looking, yet sexually repressed pastor on the ministry of the air. Rhonda’s attempts to bring the message of God to to the youth of America, and her new found connection with the Reverend have repercussions for the rest of her family. Her beautiful and promiscuous sister Lenore (Dominique Davalos) sets out to cure the reverend of his repression. She is driven by her brother-in-law, Jerome, a man determined to reap the benefits of the evangelist’s wealth when he resorts to blackmailing the man of cloth. A quirky parody of electronic evangelism set to an energetic soundtrack.

results.title: Salvador Allende Gossens: a testimony
results.creator_credit: Maurice Bulbulian, Michel Gauthier, Jean-Marc Garand and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A brief acquaintance with the president of Chile before his assassination in September, 1973. In 1972, several miners from Quebec went to Chile to observe mining operations there. They also met with the President of the Republic. Salvador Allende explains, publicly at a meeting of icampannerors, as well as in a conference with the visitors, the revolutionary socio-economic reforms he envisages for his country, which include nationalisation of the copper industry. Rene Levesque, Theo Gagne and Joseph Gosselin appear in the film. (A film for all students of political change. With English subtitles)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maurice Bulbulian, Michel Gauthier, Jean-Marc Garand and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Salty
results.creator_credit: Marion Lee, Georgina Harper, Sonia Whiteman and Victorian College of the Arts
results.brief_description: Short drama about a fleeting first love between a teenage girl and boy living in an urban beach community. Figuring the couple against an elemental background of eternal sky and sea, the narrative builds on the accumulation of tender moments between them, until the time comes when the boy must leave. Through his fascination with sea salt as a symbol of permanence, the film contrasts the boy’s state of unsettledness with the girl’s solid sense of place. Cast includes Tom Budge and Jacqui Swallow.

results.title: Salt, saliva, sperm and sweat (AFC)
results.creator_credit: Rod Bishop, Philip Brophy and 1 for Dumb Films
results.brief_description: A relentless journey into the banalities of everyday life - a film about the body - eating, excreting, sex, violence, masturbation and terror. The voyeuristic camera lewdly follows Phillip Dean, an extraordinarily ordinary office worker, to the office, to the toilet, to the same French restaurant every night and finally to bed. The film depicts the “body” as an all consuming machine which has its basis in the consumption and ejaculation of moisture in the forms of salt, saliva, sweat and sperm. Starring Phillip Dean, Jean Kitson, Lyndal Barry, Robert Chuter, Daniel Scharf, Cheyanne Armitage, Nicholas Kanigan and Martina Murray. Best Australian Film - 1988 Melbourne Film Festival.
